page.title: 02Customs
page.content: {Montrose}has several local customs-The {Rose Queen}and{The Curfew Bell}being the main ones. The{Rose Queen}event started in 1936, marking the beginning of the holiday season. A third year girl is selected to become the{Rose Queen}and is "crowned" in the Dean's Park in June. The name{"Rose Queen"}comes from the rose on the town coat-of-arms. The ringing of the{Curfew Bell}dates from Medieval Times when the towsfolk were awakened "at four hours in ye morning" and put to sleep "at ten o'clock nytlie except ye Sabbathe nyt." This custom is still maintained by the Council.The bell "Big Peter" is rung 200 times every night,except Sunday, at ten o'clock. When the present bellringer retires the ringing of the bell will become electronic.
